title: 'Drunk' female passenger arrested after 'punching easyJet flight attendant'

A 'drunk' female passenger on board an easyjet flight from London to Ibiza was arrested by Spanish police after 'punching a flight attendant'.
The shocking incident caused the pilot of flight EZY3043 from Stansted to the holiday island to divert to Barcelona this morning, where the woman was removed from the plane.
It is believed she was travelling in a group of three, with the other two females allowed to continue on to Ibiza.
A woman was arrested after allegedly punching a male flight attendant on a London to Ibiza easyJet flight
A fellow passenger on board the flight, who wishes to remain anonymous, described how the incident unfolded.
He told MailOnline Travel: 'Three girls boarded the plane from Stansted, for the 6am flight, and it was clear they were completely drunk.
'Mid-flight there was something happening at the back of the plane, and everyone was turning around.

Share this article Share 1.8k shares 'I was shocked to see one of the girls was screaming and shouting and punching the flight attendant.
'We were probably only about 30 minutes from Ibiza, but the pilot came on and said we would have to land in Barcelona. There, the police came on and the girl was taken off the plane.
'Even when she was in the police car, she was kicking and screaming, it was a shocking incident.'
The plane was delayed for around an hour, before flying on to Ibiza.
The plane was delayed for around an hour at Barcelona Airport, before flying on to Ibiza to allow passengers to enjoy their sunshine holiday
The male passenger says that it was announced the girl would be 'banned for life' from easyJet for the behaviour, but he thinks serious questions need asking as to how the woman, who he says was 'about 22 or 23,' was allowed on the plane.
'I just can't believe they let people like that on the plane. It was clear to see she was not fit to fly,' he added.
'But I must say I thought the easyJet staff on board handled the situation brilliantly, as did the captain.
'As she was being led off, everyone was booing, and she was still kicking off.'
A spokesperson for easyJet told MailOnline Travel: 'easyJet can confirm that flight EZY3043 from London Stansted to Ibiza diverted to Barcelona due to a passenger onboard behaving disruptively.
'The safety and wellbeing of passengers and crew is always easyJet's priority. Police met the aircraft on landing and the passenger was arrested. The aircraft has continued to Ibiza.
'While such incidents are rare we take them very seriously, do not tolerate abusive or threatening behaviour onboard and always push for prosecution.'
